titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Better Brooklyn Committee records 1978.121
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

did.abstract: The Better Brooklyn Committee records include correspondence, memorabilia, minutes, pamphlets, partial list of supporters, lists of candidates, and recipients of Brooklyn Hall of Fame and College Student Awards. The records also include two photographs, portraits of Charles Isaacs (L.I.U. Brooklyn Center) and F.W. Richmond.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Better Brooklyn Committee records, 1978.121, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The records were formally accessioned in 1978.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Brooklyn Hall of Fame and College Student Awards were sponsored by the Better Brooklyn Committee, founded by John La Carte in 1960. The aim of the Better Brooklyn Committee was to "help perpetuate the names of those who contributed to the advancement...honor the self-made...whose achievements will inspire our youth...the builders of a Better Brooklyn."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Better Brooklyn Committee records include correspondence, memorabilia, minutes, pamphlets, partial list of supporters, lists of candidates, and recipients of Brooklyn Hall of Fame and College Student Awards.The records also include two photographs, portraits of Charles Isaacs (L.I.U. Brooklyn Center) and F.W. Richmond.
